channel.title: Filming on Xbox360
channel.description: Is there anyway to film my actions on Xbox 360, without buing any devices, but just connect it via internet?

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

[quote=“nG Krypton, post:12, topic:261968”][quote author=A Legend link=topic=345967.msg2700379#msg2700379 date=1236553631]

Is there anyway to film my actions on Xbox 360, without buing any devices, but just connect it via internet?

There isn’t a way to be able to “Capture” what you are doing on the xbox unless you buy a “UAV Capture Card” they tend to change in price’s, if your wanting one with a good quality you’ll be looking around 60+ pound.
[/quote]

Bullshit 60+ pounds, you can get a Dazzle DVC 170 for around £40 with all the accessories, such as A/V Splitters etc.[/quote]
No, when he said pounds he was refering to the currency. Not the feces of a bull.
[center] [/center]

Read full topic

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @nG_Krypton nG Krypton
item.description:
@nG_Krypton wrote:

A Legend:

[quote]Is there anyway to film my actions on Xbox 360, without buing any devices, but just connect it via internet?

There isn’t a way to be able to “Capture” what you are doing on the xbox unless you buy a “UAV Capture Card” they tend to change in price’s, if your wanting one with a good quality you’ll be looking around 60+ pound.[/quote]

Bullshit 60+ pounds, you can get a Dazzle DVC 170 for around £40 with all the accessories, such as A/V Splitters etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

Is there anyway to film my actions on Xbox 360, without buing any devices, but just connect it via internet?

There isn’t a way to be able to “Capture” what you are doing on the xbox unless you buy a “UAV Capture Card” they tend to change in price’s, if your wanting one with a good quality you’ll be looking around 60+ pound.

Read full topic

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

EzCap works pretty good, if you look around you can get it for just 10 quid, only problem is that in the UK you have to set your Xbox to 50Hz if you want to record in colour.

Read full topic

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:7, topic:261968”][quote author=chrham2 link=topic=345967.msg2697388#msg2697388 date=1236377732]
I really want something which is FREE
[/quote]

That’s why I suggested you use a dvd player, it’s probably the only thing you can do to record without buying anything extra.[/quote]
u mean dvd recorder? ive never seen a dvd player that records

Read full topic

item.title: Filming on Xbox360
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Niall:

Uhh, you could plug your XBox into a DVD player using one of these and then the DVD player into your TV, then record using your DVD player.

Wow that brings me back to the days when my mate had a Video/TV Combi and we would record PlayStation on VHS Tapes and watch it for the sake of it!

Ontopic:
Watch this! (Related to Nialls response)

Read full topic
